intro: Neea darienensis, commonly known as the Darien nee, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly in Colombia and Panama. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and cranberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as montane forests and cloud forests. Its botanical features include elliptical leaves with a leathery texture and pink or white flowers that bloom in spring. Neea darienensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
